welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “What parts of a website do you visit most often—top menu, footer links, main articles? Why?” Students share with a partner and then discuss.

aim.data: State the agenda and objective: Understand the role of semantic HTML and implement <header>, <footer>, <nav>, <main>, <section>, and <article> in a web page.

review.data: Recap HTML structure from the previous lesson. Ask students about their use of divs and the importance of clear structure.

relevant.data: Mini-lecture on semantic HTML and its advantages (accessibility, SEO). Live demo in WebStorm using all key semantic tags in a page structure.

interactive.data: Students build their own semantic HTML page with a header, navigation, main content (with section and article), and a footer. Use of WebStorm and preview.

ownership.data: Students style and personalize their page (optional), push it to GitHub Pages, and submit the live link to Canvas.

resonate.data: Exit Ticket: "Why is using semantic tags better than using <div> for everything? Name one benefit."

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, GitHub account access, projector, optional HTML handout.
